intro: Crudia antillana, commonly known as the West Indian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom throughout the year in warm climates. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
